SIBES 0.9
  • Reference

sibes_species_search This function use keywords to search the species tibble. This is convenient if only parts of a name are known, or for example, when multiple species need to be selected with a shared keyword

Source: R/sibes_species.R
sibes_species_search.Rd

sibes_species_search This function use keywords to search the species tibble. This is convenient if only parts of a name are known, or for example, when multiple species need to be selected with a shared keyword

sibes_species_search(Inputdata = NULL, Key = NULL)

Arguments

Inputdata

Input data for the function is the output format of sibes_load which is data list of tibbels including "species". If these names are not present, the function returns an error

Key

The keyword to search for as a string. Numeric values also entered as character

Value

Function returns the found search.

Examples


data_list <- get('SIBES_dataset')

sibes_species_search(data_list[["species"]], Key='57|34|67')
#>    sibes_id                   name short_name aphia_id taxonomic_group
